brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the safety and efficacy of the administration of Iguratimod (CRM01T) for 52
      weeks in participants with rheumatoid arthritis in clinical practice.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Safety and Efficacy of Iguratimod in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  Participants with rheumatoid arthritis

          -  All participants who take iguratimod

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  Participants who have registered for this survey before

          -  Pregnant women or women suspected of being pregnant

          -  Participants with serious liver disease

          -  Participant with peptic ulcer

          -  Participants with known hypersensitivity to iguratimod or any of its excipients

intervention.description: The usual adult dosage for oral use of 25 mg tablet of iguratimod once daily for 4 weeks or more, after which the dosage should be increased to one 25 mg tablet taken twice daily.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Safety and Efficacy of Iguratimod in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

overall_contact.last_name: Customer Information Services Department. CRC and QA

overall_official.affiliation: Drug Fostering and Evolution Coordination Department, Eisai Co., Ltd.

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

primary_outcome.description:
DAS28 is a quantitative tool used to measure and monitor disease activity and treatment of rheumatoid arthritis. DAS28 uses a formula that includes the number of tender joints and swollen joints for a maximum of 28 joints.
DAS28 is used to assess whether an individual participant has a significant improvement of the disease activity, compared to baseline.
Good response: Baseline DAS28 <=3.2 (low disease activity); DAS28 improvement > 1.2
Moderate response: Baseline DAS28 <= 3.2; DAS28 improvement > 0.6 and <= 1.2 or Baseline DAS28 > 3.2 and <= 5.1; DAS28 improvement > 0.6 or Baseline DAS28 > 5.1; DAS28 improvement > 1.2
No response: Baseline DAS28 > 5.1 (high disease activity); DAS28 improvement <= 1.2 or DAS28 improvement <= 0.6
primary_outcome.measure: Disease Activity Score (DAS28) for Rheumatoid Arthritis (EULAR [European League Against Rheumatism] Response Criteria)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
